properties.article_headline: Meatball, a 36-pound cat, dropped off at Mesa shelter
properties.article_desc: The 4-year-old domestic shorthaired lives in an office and relieves himself in a Rubbermaid under-bed storage container because, at 36 pounds, he’s too large for a normal cat’s accommodations.

properties.article_headline: Is It Worth Shutting Down Two Train Lines to Save a Couple of Kittens?
properties.article_desc: What is the life of a cat worth? The MTA faced this vexing philosophical question earlier today when two tiny kittens — it's unknown whether they were strays or pets, but nobody in the vicinity seemed to own them — were spotted scurrying around on the tracks at the Church Avenue B/Q stop in Prospect Lefferts Gardens.

properties.article_headline: Catcopter: Dutch artist turns his dead pet into a helicopter
properties.article_desc: The Dutch artist Bart Jansen makes his dead cat Orville fly, after having him stuffed and mounting propellers to his legs.
